page.title: 01GOODNESTONE VILLAGE
page.content: The Village is tucked in a fold of rolling countryside and is designated as a conservation area. The village consists of a small council estate called Hospital Meadow Cottages; some old peoples housing; the village Post Office and general store; the Church of England School; the FitzWalter Arms; Church of the Holy Cross and the Mansion. The remaining houses are almost all owned by the Lord FitzWalter. Since the village has no through road it is rather isolated; some say it is quite feudal. Most people use it as a place to live, finding their employment elsewhere.
